word: I. H. EVANS--WHEN ANYBODY GETS A TESTIMONY, ISN'T IT A FACT THAT IT IS HARD FOR THE FELLOW TO SEE THE THING THAT THE TESTIMONY TRIES TO CORRECT, SIMPLY BECAUSE IF HE COULD SEE IT, WHAT WOULD BE THE NEED OF THE TESTIMONY TELLING IT TO HIM? HE WOULD TRY TO PUT IT AWAY HIMSELF: BUT HE DOES NOT SEE IT, AND SO THE TESTIMONY SPEAKS. NOW I THINK THAT TAKES US ALL IN, AND I FOR ONE WOULD LIKE TO GET RIGHT.
